item.title: Harpoon: an OSINT / Threat Intelligence tool
item.description:
TL;DR

Harpoon is a tool to automate threat intelligence and open source intelligence tasks. It is written in Python 3 and organised in plugins so the idea is to have one plugin per platform or task. The code is on Github, feel free to open issues and propose Pull Requests.

Install and config:

pip install git+ssh://git@github.com/Te-k/harpoon  --process-dependency-links
npm install -g phantomjs
harpoon config -u
harpoon config

Then check how to use every module with harpoon help MODULE

item.title: Another PE tool
item.description: Analyzing PE files is a basic task in reverse engineering in order to understand their structure, look for anything interesting before going more in depth into the reverse engineering in itself. There are countless tools to do that, on Windows I use PeStudio, PEView and Resource Hacker. But most of the time I want to have a first view of the file before starting my Virtual Machine, so I was looking for a CLI tool on Linux. There is of course PEScanner published by Michael Ligh with the good Malware Analyst’s Cookbook but it is a bit outdated (python2 only) and I like to write my own tools to be sure I understand how they work and what are their limits.
